configinteger.name: listlimit
configinteger.desc: On installations with large numbers of galleries, it can be useful to disallow using select lists for gallery selection in blocks. Set this to the maximum number of galleries that can be displayed in a gallery drop down list. If more than this number of galleries would appear, then selection list will be disabled.

configboolean.name: downloadzip
configboolean.desc: Allow the ability to download an entire gallery as a .zip file? This is a potential performance hit, and will likely require a larger memory_limit value.

configboolean.name: customlabel
configboolean.desc: Allow the ability to query the preference backend for other user's identities? This is a performance hit, but will allow for displaying something like "John Smith's Galleries" instead of "jsmith's Galleries". It also allows a user to specify a custom description to be displayed. So, for example instead of "John Smith's Galleries", the user could use "John's Family Photos". This requires a preference backend that doesn't require an explicit login by the user whose preferences we are trying to read. If you are getting errors regarding unloadable preferences when loading Ansel, try turning this off.

configboolean.name: print
configboolean.desc: Should we display a Print link in Ansel's menu?

configmultienum.name: apps
configmultienum.desc: Select any applications that should be linked in Ansel's menu

configswitch.name: src
configswitch.desc: How should Horde serve the photo files from the VFS? If choosing the Sendfile option, you will need a webserver that supports either the X-Sendfile or the X-LIGHTTPD-send-file headers. If choosing the VFS-Direct option, be aware that this will bypass any permissions checking. Anyone that knows or can guess the URL can view the photo. This option is also only useable with a file based VFS. The PHP option streams the photo through PHP and is the least efficient, but most compatible, choice.

configstring.desc: Specify an alias pointing to the right place on your filesystem defined in your webserver. Eg. '/ansel-images/'
configstring.name: path

configenum.name: type
configenum.desc: What format should photos be generated in? Make sure that your server supports whichever format you choose!

configstring.name: autogen
configstring.desc: Should Ansel automatically generate the screen, thumb, and mini photo views immediately after upload? This will only work when uploading from Ansel's UI and not when uploading via the api or mechanisms such as XP Publish. Set this to the maximum number of photos that may be automatically generated. A value of zero will disable the feature

configboolean.name: prettythumbs
configboolean.desc: Allow the selection of gallery themes and generation of 'pretty' thumbnails? This can be a performance hit the first time the thumbnails are generated.

configstring.name: num_uploads
configstring.desc: How many photos should a user be allowed to upload at once?

configstring.name: font
configstring.desc: What font would you like to use when watermarking photos? If you leave this blank, the default for the particular photo manipulation functions will be used. Make sure you select a font that is present on your system!

configboolean.name: enable
configboolean.desc: Allow users to send photos as ecards?

configenum.name: allow
configenum.desc: Can users comment on photos? Note that this functionality requires the presence of an application that provides the forums API (such as Agora).

configboolean.name: usecache
configboolean.desc: Should we save frequently run queries and permissions checks in the cache? This will reduce load on your database server, but could delay the appearance of newly tagged photos while browsing tags.

configboolean.name: relatedtags
configboolean.desc: Allow the display of related tags? Related tags allow you to easily browse a tag hierarchy, but could be a performance hit on sites with a large number of similarly tagged photos since an additional SQL query is performed per related tag.

configstring.name: search
configstring.desc: Enable the similar photo functionality for finding similar faces? Set to 0 to disable, or enter the size, in bytes, that should be used as the photo's index length. If you don't know what this is, the default value should be OK for most people. You need the libpuzzle pecl extension to use this feature.
